intro: Hemiphues novae-zelandiae, commonly known as the New Zealand hemiphue, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the temperate climate of the region. Its leaves are leathery and evergreen, providing year-round foliage. Hemiphues novae-zelandiae is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens.
